arm_group.description: Patients who have Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia undergoing Transurethral Vaporization of Prostate and are on anticoagulant medication

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this observational study is to evaluate the outcomes of using the
      PlasmaButton electrode in the treatment on Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia while on
      anticoagulation medication.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Symptomatic BPH Patients Undergoing Anticoagulant Therapy Using the PlasmaButton Vaporization Electrode

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Men with obstructive symptoms due to benign prostatic hyperplasia who are also on
             anticoagulant regiment.

          -  Anticoagulant regiments include: Aspirin 81mg, Aspirin 325mg, Adenosine diphosphate
             (ADP) receptor inhibitors, Cilostazol, Dabigatran, Dipyridamole, or Warfarin. The
             patient will be stable on their dosage regimen for at least 3 months.

          -  Maximum flow rate <15ml/s by uroflowmetry.

          -  International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS)≥10.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with coagulopathy, INR exceeding 3.

          -  Anti-coagulation dose changes within 3 months of surgery.

          -  Patients not medically cleared to undergo surgery for medical reasons.

          -  Patients with neurogenic bladder (bladder affected due to a neurologic cause).

          -  Urethral stricture, obstruction due to stricture.

          -  Suspected bladder or prostate cancer.

          -  Prostate size greater than 80 cc.

study_pop.textblock:
Symptomatic BPH patients seen at Urology clinic at Loma Linda University Medical Center
        and VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System

facility.name: Loma Linda University Medical Center Urology Department
VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System

clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Symptomatic BPH Patients Undergoing Anticoagulant Therapy Using the PlasmaButton Vaporization Electrode - An Observational Study

overall_official.affiliation: VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System

primary_outcome.measure: Complication rates when the PlasmaButton Electrode is used to perform TUVP ransurethral Vaporization of the Prostate) on patients on anticoagulants

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of subjective patient improvement on the International Prostate Symptom Score questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before surgery and 1, 3, 6 month follow up visits

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of subjective patient improvement on the Sexual Health for Men (SHIM) score
Measurement of maximum urine flow rate as measured by urine flowmetry

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
